sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new layout/BorderLayoutArea. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getAreaId areaId} : sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutAreaTypes (default: top)
    • {@link #getOverflowX overflowX} : string (default: auto)
    • {@link #getOverflowY overflowY} : string (default: auto)
    • {@link #getContentAlign contentAlign} : string (default: left)
    • {@link #getSize size} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100px)
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

getAreaId.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.3.3 Redundant to the aggregation by the parent border layout.
Gets current value of property {@link #getAreaId areaId}. Defines which area the element represents: top, begin, center, end, bottom Default value is top.

getVisible.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getVisible visible}. Invisible controls are not rendered Default value is true.

sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.Page control.
The BorderLayoutArea represents one area of a BorderLayout

insertContent.!description: Inserts a content into the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The content to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the content should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the content is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the content is inserted at the last position

setOverflowX.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getOverflowX overflowX}. The overflow mode of the area in horizontal direction as CSS value When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is auto.

parameters.sOverflowX: type: string, description: New value for property overflowX

setOverflowY.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getOverflowY overflowY}. The overflow mode of the area in vertical direction as CSS value When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is auto.

parameters.sOverflowY: type: string, description: New value for property overflowY

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea.

sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.Page control.
The BorderLayoutArea represents one area of a BorderLayout

getRanges.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getRanges ranges}.

The ranges defined for this container

attachRangeSwitch.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:rangeSwitch rangeSwitch} event of this sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainer. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainer itself. The event is fired the width of the container reaches a new range.
attachRangeSwitch.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainer

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainer itself

parameters.oDefaultContent: type: sap.ui.core.ID|sap.ui.core.Control, description: ID of an element which becomes the new target of this defaultContent association; alternatively, an element instance may be given

detachRangeSwitch.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:rangeSwitch rangeSwitch} event of this sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainer. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

removeRange.!description: Removes a range from the aggregation {@link #getRanges ranges}.

parameters.vRange: type: int|string|sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainerRange, description: The range to remove or its index or id

insertRange.!description: Inserts a range into the aggregation {@link #getRanges ranges}.

parameters.oRange: type: sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainerRange, description: The range to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the range should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the range is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the range is inserted at the last position

indexOfRange.!description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainerRange in the aggregation {@link #getRanges ranges}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

parameters.oRange: type: sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainerRange, description: The range whose index is looked for

sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainer.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ResponsiveContainer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getRanges ranges} : sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainerRange[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getDefaultContent defaultContent} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:rangeSwitch rangeSwitch} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

destroyRanges.!description: Destroys all the ranges in the aggregation {@link #getRanges ranges}.

getHeight.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getHeight height}. The width of the responsive container. Default value is 100%.

sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainer.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Use a container by choice from the {@link sap.m} library, instead.
Is used to provide a container, which can show different content depending on its current width. It fires an event, whenever a new range is reached. In addition the content of the new range is automatically shown, if it is set.

getDefaultContent.!description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association {@link #getDefaultContent defaultContent}, or null.

setHeight.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getHeight height}. The width of the responsive container. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 100%.

parameters.sHeight: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property height

addRange.!description: Adds some range to the aggregation {@link #getRanges ranges}.

parameters.oRange: type: sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainerRange, description: The range to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

getWidth.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getWidth width}. The width of the responsive container. Default value is 100%.

fireRangeSwitch.!description: Fires event {@link #event:rangeSwitch rangeSwitch} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

setWidth.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getWidth width}. The width of the responsive container. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 100%.

parameters.sWidth: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property width

removeAllRanges.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getRanges ranges}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainer.

sap.ui.commons.ResponsiveContainer.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Use a container by choice from the {@link sap.m} library, instead.
Is used to provide a container, which can show different content depending on its current width. It fires an event, whenever a new range is reached. In addition the content of the new range is automatically shown, if it is set.

sap.ui.commons.Area.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Area. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getShape shape} : string
    • {@link #getCoords coords} : string
    • {@link #getHref href} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getAlt alt} : string
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

setShape.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShape shape}. The value is a string and can be 'rect' for rectangle, 'poly' for poligon, 'circle', or default. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sShape: type: string, description: New value for property shape

setAlt.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getAlt alt}. Alternative text that is displayed in the case the image is not available When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sAlt: type: string, description: New value for property alt

getCoords.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getCoords coords}.

Coordinates of the area

sap.ui.commons.Area.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 undefined
Used for defining areas in an image map. At runtime, the user can trigger an action, or start a URL, from the single image areas.

setHref.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getHref href}. Hyper link that is executed when the area is clicked When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sHref: type: sap.ui.core.URI, description: New value for property href

getHref.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getHref href}.

Hyper link that is executed when the area is clicked

getShape.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getShape shape}.

The value is a string and can be 'rect' for rectangle, 'poly' for poligon, 'circle', or default.

sap.ui.commons.Area.!helpDescription:

Used for defining areas in an image map. At runtime, the user can trigger an action, or start a URL, from the single image areas.

MediumWithLine.!description: A medium (31px) vertical gutter with a vertical line in its middle.

Medium.!description: A medium (31px) vertical gutter without a vertical line.

sap.ui.commons.layout.Separation.!description: Separation, e.g. of a layout cell from its neighbor, via a vertical gutter of defined width, with or without a vertical line in its middle.

SmallWithLine.!description: A small (17px) vertical gutter with a vertical line in its middle.

Large.!description: A large (63px) vertical gutter without a vertical line.

None.!description: No gutter at all (0px), and without a vertical line, of course.

LargeWithLine.!description: A large (63px) vertical gutter with a vertical line in its middle.

Small.!description: A small (17px) vertical gutter without a vertical line.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

getWidth.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getWidth width}.

Width of text field. When it is set (CSS-size such as % or px), this is the exact size. When left blank, the text field length defines the width.

getImeMode.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getImeMode imeMode}. State of the Input Method Editor (IME). Default value is Auto.

onselectstart.!description: Event handler called when text selection starts. When the text field is disabled, the text should not be selectable, so cancel the event.

parameters.oEvent: type: jQuery.Event, description: The event object.

getEditable.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEditable editable}. Switches edit state of the control. Read-only fields have different colors, depending on theme setting. Default value is true.

setImeMode.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getImeMode imeMode}. State of the Input Method Editor (IME). When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Auto.

parameters.sImeMode: type: sap.ui.core.ImeMode, description: New value for property imeMode

getRequired.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getRequired required}. Depending on theme the TextField is shown as required. If a Label is assigned to the TextField it will visualize the requires state too. Default value is false.

onkeyup.!description: Event handler for keyup. fire the liveChange event

parameters.oEvent: type: jQuery.Event, description: The event object.

sap.ui.commons.TextField.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new TextField. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getValue value} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getTextDirection textDirection} : sap.ui.core.TextDirection (default: Inherit)
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getRequired required} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getMaxLength maxLength} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getValueState valueState} : sap.ui.core.ValueState (default: None)
    • {@link #getTextAlign textAlign} : sap.ui.core.TextAlign (default: Begin)
    • {@link #getImeMode imeMode} : sap.ui.core.ImeMode (default: Auto)
    • {@link #getDesign design} : sap.ui.core.Design (default: Standard)
    • {@link #getHelpId helpId} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getAccessibleRole accessibleRole} : sap.ui.core.AccessibleRole (default: Textbox)
    • {@link #getName name} : string
    • {@link #getPlaceholder placeholder} : string
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:liveChange liveChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

setHelpId.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getHelpId helpId}. Unique identifier used for help service. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is empty string.

parameters.sHelpId: type: string, description: New value for property helpId

onsapenter.!description: Event handler called when enter key is pressed.

parameters.oEvent: type: jQuery.Event, description: The event object.

getTextAlign.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getTextAlign textAlign}. Sets the horizontal alignment of the text. Default value is Begin.

getAccessibleRole.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getAccessibleRole accessibleRole}. Accessibility role for the text field. Default value is Textbox.

addAriaLabelledBy.!description: Adds some ariaLabelledBy into the association {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy}.

parameters.vAriaLabelledBy: type: sap.ui.core.ID|sap.ui.core.Control, description: The ariaLabelledBy to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

unbindValue.!description: Unbinds property {@link #getValue value} from model data.

fireChange.!description: Fires event {@link #event:change change} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

setName.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getName name}. The name property to be used in the HTML code (e.g. for HTML forms that send data to the server via 'submit'). When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sName: type: string, description: New value for property name

setDesign.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getDesign design}. Font type. valid values are Standard and Monospace. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Standard.

parameters.sDesign: type: sap.ui.core.Design, description: New value for property design

Deprecated! Since 1.38 replaced by {@link sap.m.Input}
Renders an input field for text input.

getValue.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getValue value}. Text inside the TextField Default value is empty string.

getTextDirection.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getTextDirection textDirection}. Direction of the text. Possible values: "rtl", "ltr". Default value is Inherit.

getEnabled.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnabled enabled}. Switches enabled state of the control. Disabled fields have different colors, and can not be focused. Default value is true.

parameters.sTextDirection: type: sap.ui.core.TextDirection, description: New value for property textDirection

parameters.iMaxLength: type: int, description: New value for property maxLength

attachLiveChange.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:liveChange liveChange} event of this sap.ui.commons.TextField. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.commons.TextField itself. This event if fired during typing into the TextField and returns the currently entered value. Note: This is not the content of the value property. The value property is only updated by ENTER and by leaving the control.

parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.commons.TextField itself

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.commons.TextField itself. Event is fired when the text in the field has changed AND the focus leaves the TextField or the Enter key is pressed.

sap.ui.commons.TextArea.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new TextArea. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getCols cols} : int
    • {@link #getRows rows} : int
    • {@link #getWrapping wrapping} : sap.ui.core.Wrapping
    • {@link #getCursorPos cursorPos} : int
    • {@link #getExplanation explanation} : string
    • {@link #getLabeledBy labeledBy} : string
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.commons.TextField#constructor sap.ui.commons.TextField} can be used as well.

setRows.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getRows rows}. Number of Rows. This proprty is only used if Height is not used. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.iRows: type: int, description: New value for property rows

parameters.iMaxLength: type: int, description: maximal length of text

setExplanation.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getExplanation explanation}. text which appears, in case quick-help is switched on When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sExplanation: type: string, description: New value for property explanation

setCursorPos.!description: Property setter for the cursor position

getExplanation.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getExplanation explanation}.

text which appears, in case quick-help is switched on

getCols.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getCols cols}.

Number of Columns. Cols means number of characters per row. This proprty is only used if Width is not used.

getHeight.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getHeight height}.

Height of text field. When it is set (CSS-size such as % or px), this is the exact size.

setWrapping.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getWrapping wrapping}. Text wrapping. Possible values are: Soft, Hard, Off. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sWrapping: type: sap.ui.core.Wrapping, description: New value for property wrapping

sap.ui.commons.TextArea.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.TextArea control.
Control to enter or display multible row text.

setHeight.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getHeight height}. Height of text field. When it is set (CSS-size such as % or px), this is the exact size. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sHeight: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property height

getRows.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getRows rows}.

Number of Rows. This proprty is only used if Height is not used.

setCols.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getCols cols}. Number of Columns. Cols means number of characters per row. This proprty is only used if Width is not used. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.iCols: type: int, description: New value for property cols

getCursorPos.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getCursorPos cursorPos}.

Position of cursor, e.g., to let the user re-start typing at the same position as before the server roundtrip

sap.ui.commons.TextArea.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.TextArea control.
Control to enter or display multible row text.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.commons.TextArea.

removeButton.!description: Removes a button from the aggregation {@link #getButtons buttons}.

parameters.vButton: type: int|string|sap.ui.commons.Button, description: The button to remove or its index or id

setText.!description: Sets the text that will be rendered in the Panel header.

parameters.sText: type: string, description: The text to render in the header.

setBorderDesign.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getBorderDesign borderDesign}. Determines if the Panel can have a box as border. Note that displaying borders is theme-dependent. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Box.

parameters.sBorderDesign: type: sap.ui.commons.enums.BorderDesign, description: New value for property borderDesign

getScrollLeft.!description: Returns the scroll position of the panel in pixels from the left. Returns 0 if not rendered yet. Also internally updates the control property.

parameters.bPadding: type: boolean, description: Whether the Panel should have padding.

setShowCollapseIcon.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowCollapseIcon showCollapseIcon}. Determines whether the Panel will have an icon for collapsing/expanding, or not. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bShowCollapseIcon: type: boolean, description: New value for property showCollapseIcon

getTitle.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getTitle title}.

Aggregates the title element of the Panel. For text titles only, you alternatively could use setText() which also creates a title in the background.

getWidth.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getWidth width}. Determines the width of the Panel in CSS size. Default value is 100%.

addContent.!description: Adds some content to the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The content to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

getApplyContentPadding.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getApplyContentPadding applyContentPadding}. Determines whether the Panel will have padding. Padding is theme-dependent. Default value is true.

setAreaDesign.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getAreaDesign areaDesign}. Determines the background color. Note that color settings are theme-dependent. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Fill.

parameters.sAreaDesign: type: sap.ui.commons.enums.AreaDesign, description: New value for property areaDesign

getContent.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

Aggregates the controls that are contained in the Panel. It is recommended to use a layout control as single direct child. When the Panel dimensions are set, the child control may have width and height of 100%. When the dimensions are not set, the child defines the size of the Panel.

removeAllContent.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

sap.ui.commons.Panel.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Panel. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getScrollLeft scrollLeft} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getScrollTop scrollTop} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getApplyContentPadding applyContentPadding} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getCollapsed collapsed} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAreaDesign areaDesign} : sap.ui.commons.enums.AreaDesign (default: Fill)
    • {@link #getBorderDesign borderDesign} : sap.ui.commons.enums.BorderDesign (default: Box)
    • {@link #getShowCollapseIcon showCollapseIcon} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getText text} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.ui.core.Title
    • {@link #getButtons buttons} : sap.ui.commons.Button[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

destroyTitle.!description: Destroys the title in the aggregation {@link #getTitle title}.

parameters.bCollapsed: type: boolean, description: Whether the Panel should be collapsed or not.

setTitle.!description: Sets a Tille control that will be rendered in the Panel header.

parameters.oTitle: type: sap.ui.core.Title, description: The Title to render in the header.

setHeight.!description: Sets the height of the panel.

parameters.sHeight: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: The height of the panel as CSS size.

getShowCollapseIcon.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowCollapseIcon showCollapseIcon}. Determines whether the Panel will have an icon for collapsing/expanding, or not. Default value is true.

setDimensions.!description: Sets the dimensions of the panel.

parameters.sWidth: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: The width of the panel as CSS size.
parameters.sHeight: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: The height of the panel as CSS size.

sap.ui.commons.Panel.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.Panel control.
Represents a container with scroll functionality, that can be used for text and controls. The Panel does not layout the embedded controls.

getEnabled.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnabled enabled}. Represents the state of the of the Panel (enabled or disabled) Default value is true.

indexOfContent.!description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.core.Control in the aggregation {@link #getContent content}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The content whose index is looked for

setScrollLeft.!description: Sets the scroll position of the panel in pixels from the left.

parameters.iPosition: type: int, description: The position to scroll to.

removeContent.!description: Removes a content from the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

parameters.vContent: type: int|string|sap.ui.core.Control, description: The content to remove or its index or id

destroyContent.!description: Destroys all the content in the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

getText.!description: Returns the text that is rendered in the Panel header. If a Title control was used it returns the text of the Title control.

setScrollTop.!description: Sets the scrolls position of the panel in pixels from the top.

parameters.iPosition: type: int, description: The position to scroll to.

getHeight.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getHeight height}.

Determines the height of the Panel in CSS size. Per default, the height for the Panel is automatically adjusted to the content. Dimension allows to explicitly specify the height.

destroyButtons.!description: Destroys all the buttons in the aggregation {@link #getButtons buttons}.

getScrollTop.!description: Returns the scroll position of the panel in pixels from the top. Returns 0 if not rendered yet. Also internally updates the control property.

indexOfButton.!description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.commons.Button in the aggregation {@link #getButtons buttons}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

parameters.oButton: type: sap.ui.commons.Button, description: The button whose index is looked for

parameters.bEnabled: type: boolean, description: Whether the Panel should be enabled or not.

getButtons.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getButtons buttons}.

The buttons that shall be displayed in the Panel header

setWidth.!description: Sets the width of the panel.

parameters.sWidth: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: The width of the panel as CSS size.

sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayout.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new layout/BorderLayout. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getRtl rtl} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getTop top} : sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea
    • {@link #getBegin begin} : sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea
    • {@link #getCenter center} : sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea
    • {@link #getEnd end} : sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea
    • {@link #getBottom bottom} : sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

parameters.oBegin: type: sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea, description: The begin to set

destroyTop.!description: Destroys the top in the aggregation {@link #getTop top}.

destroyCenter.!description: Destroys the center in the aggregation {@link #getCenter center}.

getAreaById.!description: Returns the object of the specified area. If the area does not exist, the area will be created and returned.

parameters.sAreaId: type: sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutAreaTypes, description: Specifies the area whose object will be returned.

insertContent.!description: Inserts controls to an area at a given index.

parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: Specifies the index where the controls shall be added. For a negative value of iIndex, the content is inserted at position '0'; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the content is inserted at the last position.
parameters.sAreaId: type: sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutAreaTypes, description: Specifies the area where the controls shall be inserted.

sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayout.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 replaced by {@link sap.m.Page}
Based upon the border layout as it comes with the Java standard. Using this layout, you are able to divide your available UI space into five areas whose sizes can be defined. These areas are: Top: Header; Bottom: Footer; Begin: Left/right-hand side panel; Center: Content area in the middle; End: Right/left-hand side panel.

getArea.!description: Returns the area of the given type. If the area does not exist, it will be created when create is set to true.

parameters.bCreate: type: boolean, description: Whether the aria must be created

setHeight.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getHeight height}. Defines the overall height of the layout When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 100%.

parameters.sHeight: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property height

parameters.oBottom: type: sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutArea, description: The bottom to set

createArea.!description: Creates the specified area and adds the given controls to it. Returns the created area.

parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: Any number of controls can be submitted to be added to the newly created area; where each control is submitted as one argument.
parameters.sAreaId: type: sap.ui.commons.layout.BorderLayoutAreaTypes, description: Specifies which area will be created. If the area is already available, the method call is ignored.

setRtl.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.5.2 replaced by the global configuration for the page
Sets a new value for property {@link #getRtl rtl}. The RTL setting swaps the areas Begin and End. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bRtl: type: boolean, description: New value for property rtl

Deprecated! Since 1.38 replaced by {@link sap.m.Page}
Based upon the border layout as it comes with the Java standard. Using this layout, you are able to divide your available UI space into five areas whose sizes can be defined. These areas are: Top: Header; Bottom: Footer; Begin: Left/right-hand side panel; Center: Content area in the middle; End: Right/left-hand side panel.

sap.ui.commons.layout.MatrixLayoutRow.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new layout/MatrixLayoutRow. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getCells cells} : sap.ui.commons.layout.MatrixLayoutCell[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

hasStyleClass.!description: Returns true if the given style class string is valid and if this Element has this style class set via a previous call to addStyleClass().

parameters.sStyleClass: type: string, description: the style to check for

getHeight.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getHeight height}.

Height of the row.

sap.ui.commons.layout.MatrixLayoutRow.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.ui.layout.Grid control.
Non-control element used as part of a matrix layout's inner structure.

setHeight.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getHeight height}. Height of the row. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sHeight: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property height

addStyleClass.!description:
The string given as "sStyleClass" will be added to the "class" attribute of this element's root HTML element. This method is intended to be used to mark controls as being of a special type for which special styling can be provided using CSS selectors that reference this style class name. 
Example:
myButton.addStyleClass("myRedTextButton"); // add a CSS class to one button instance

...and in CSS:
.myRedTextButton {
color: red;
}
This will add the CSS class "myRedTextButton" to the Button HTML and the CSS code above will then make the text in this particular button red. Only characters allowed inside HTML attributes are allowed. Quotes are not allowed and this method will ignore any strings containing quotes. Strings containing spaces are interpreted as ONE custom style class (even though CSS selectors interpret them as different classes) and can only removed later by calling removeStyleClass() with exactly the same (space-containing) string as parameter. Multiple calls with the same sStyleClass will have no different effect than calling once. If sStyleClass is null, the call is ignored. Returns this to allow method chaining

parameters.sStyleClass: type: string, description: the CSS class name to be added

removeCell.!description: Removes a cell from the aggregation {@link #getCells cells}.

parameters.vCell: type: int|string|sap.ui.commons.layout.MatrixLayoutCell, description: The cell to remove or its index or id

Determines the width of the Carousel

setWidth.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getWidth width}. Determines the width of the Carousel When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sWidth: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property width

setVisibleItems.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getVisibleItems visibleItems}. If defined, the carousel displays the number of items defined. parameters.iVisibleItems: type: int, description: New value for property visibleItems

getHandleSize.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getHandleSize handleSize}. Determines the size of the handle in pixels. (Height for vertical carousel, width for horizontal carousel) Default value is 22.

parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The content to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

Default height of the item in a carousel if no height can be determined When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 150.

parameters.iDefaultItemHeight: type: int, description: New value for property defaultItemHeight

removeAllContent.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

getContent.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

Controls which are displayed inside the Carousel

getOrientation.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getOrientation orientation}. Determines the orientation of the Carousel. Can be either "horizontal" or "vertical" Default value is horizontal.

getDefaultItemWidth.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDefaultItemWidth defaultItemWidth}. Default width of the item in a carousel if no height can be determined Default value is 150.

sap.ui.commons.Carousel.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Carousel. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getOrientation orientation} : sap.ui.commons.enums.Orientation (default: horizontal)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getDefaultItemHeight defaultItemHeight} : int (default: 150)
    • {@link #getDefaultItemWidth defaultItemWidth} : int (default: 150)
    • {@link #getAnimationDuration animationDuration} : int (default: 500)
    • {@link #getVisibleItems visibleItems} : int
    • {@link #getHandleSize handleSize} : int (default: 22)
    • {@link #getFirstVisibleIndex firstVisibleIndex} : int (default: 0)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.Carousel.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.Carousel control.
Carousel holds multiple controls and displays them vertically or horizontally next to each other. You can define how many content items should be displayed at once or let the Carousel determine that for you. Navigation is done through buttons or keys.

insertContent.!description: Inserts a content into the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The content to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the content should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the content is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the content is inserted at the last position

setHeight.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getHeight height}. Determines the height of the Carousel When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sHeight: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property height

unbindContent.!description: Unbinds aggregation {@link #getContent content} from model data.

setHandleSize.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getHandleSize handleSize}. Determines the size of the handle in pixels. (Height for vertical carousel, width for horizontal carousel) When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 22.

parameters.iHandleSize: type: int, description: New value for property handleSize

showElementWithId.!description: Shows the element with the specified Id. This can be only used after the component is rendered.

parameters.sElementId: type: string, description: Id of the element to slide to.

onswiperight.!description: If the device supports touch gestures and right swipe is triggered shows the previous carousel item

parameters.oEvent: type: jQuery.Event, description: undefined

Carousel holds multiple controls and displays them vertically or horizontally next to each other. You can define how many content items should be displayed at once or let the Carousel determine that for you. Navigation is done through buttons or keys.

sap.ui.commons.SearchField.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new SearchField. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEnableListSuggest enableListSuggest} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowListExpander showListExpander} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableClear enableClear} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowExternalButton showExternalButton} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableCache enableCache} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableFilterMode enableFilterMode} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getValue value} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getMaxLength maxLength} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getValueState valueState} : sap.ui.core.ValueState (default: None)
    • {@link #getPlaceholder placeholder} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getTextAlign textAlign} : sap.ui.core.TextAlign (default: Begin)
    • {@link #getVisibleItemCount visibleItemCount} : int (default: 20)
    • {@link #getStartSuggestion startSuggestion} : int (default: 3)
    • {@link #getMaxSuggestionItems maxSuggestionItems} : int (default: 10)
    • {@link #getMaxHistoryItems maxHistoryItems} : int (default: 0)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSearchProvider searchProvider} : sap.ui.core.search.SearchProvider
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:search search} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:suggest suggest} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

getTextAlign.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getTextAlign textAlign}. Sets the horizontal alignment of the text Default value is Begin.

addAriaLabelledBy.!description: Adds some ariaLabelledBy into the association {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy}.

parameters.vAriaLabelledBy: type: sap.ui.core.ID|sap.ui.core.Control, description: The ariaLabelledBy to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

setVisibleItemCount.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getVisibleItemCount visibleItemCount}. Defines the number of items in the suggestion list that shall be displayed at once. If the overall number of list items is higher than the setting, a scroll bar is provided. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 20.

parameters.iVisibleItemCount: type: int, description: New value for property visibleItemCount

getEnableFilterMode.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableFilterMode enableFilterMode}. Defines whether the search event should also be fired when the SearchField is empty (like a Filter field) and when the clear button (if activated) is pressed. Default value is false.

setEnableFilterMode.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getEnableFilterMode enableFilterMode}. Defines whether the search event should also be fired when the SearchField is empty (like a Filter field) and when the clear button (if activated) is pressed. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bEnableFilterMode: type: boolean, description: New value for property enableFilterMode

getEnableListSuggest.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableListSuggest enableListSuggest}. Defines whether a pop up list shall be provided for suggestions Default value is true.

getMaxHistoryItems.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getMaxHistoryItems maxHistoryItems}. Maximum number of history items in the suggestion list. 0 displays and stores no history. The history is locally stored on the client. Therefore do not activate this feature when this control handles confidential data. Default value is 0.

sap.ui.commons.SearchField.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.SearchField control.
Allows the user to type search queries and to trigger the search. Optionally, suggestions can be added.

getEnableCache.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableCache enableCache}. When list suggestion is enabled all suggestions are cached and no suggest event is fired. Default value is true.

getValue.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getValue value}. Text that shall be displayed within the search field Default value is empty string.

getEnabled.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnabled enabled}. Disabled fields have different colors, and they can not be focused. Default value is true.

getMaxLength.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getMaxLength maxLength}. Maximum number of characters. Value '0' means the feature is switched off. Default value is 0.

setMaxHistoryItems.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getMaxHistoryItems maxHistoryItems}. Maximum number of history items in the suggestion list. 0 displays and stores no history. The history is locally stored on the client. Therefore do not activate this feature when this control handles confidential data. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0.

parameters.iMaxHistoryItems: type: int, description: New value for property maxHistoryItems

getValueState.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getValueState valueState}. Visualizes warnings or errors related to the input field. Possible values: Warning, Error, Success, None. Default value is None.

removeAriaDescribedBy.!description: Removes an ariaDescribedBy from the association named {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy}.

parameters.vAriaDescribedBy: type: int|sap.ui.core.ID|sap.ui.core.Control, description: The ariaDescribedBy to be removed or its index or ID

setMaxSuggestionItems.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getMaxSuggestionItems maxSuggestionItems}. Maximum number of suggestion items in the suggestion list. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 10.

parameters.iMaxSuggestionItems: type: int, description: New value for property maxSuggestionItems

setPlaceholder.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getPlaceholder placeholder}. Placeholder for the input field. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is empty string.

parameters.sPlaceholder: type: string, description: New value for property placeholder

getAriaDescribedBy.!description: Returns array of IDs of the elements which are the current targets of the association {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy}.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.commons.SearchField itself. Event which is fired when the user triggers a search

setValueState.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getValueState valueState}. Visualizes warnings or errors related to the input field. Possible values: Warning, Error, Success, None. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is None.

parameters.sValueState: type: sap.ui.core.ValueState, description: New value for property valueState

addAriaDescribedBy.!description: Adds some ariaDescribedBy into the association {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy}.

parameters.vAriaDescribedBy: type: sap.ui.core.ID|sap.ui.core.Control, description: The ariaDescribedBy to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

setEnabled.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getEnabled enabled}. Disabled fields have different colors, and they can not be focused. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bEnabled: type: boolean, description: New value for property enabled

fireSearch.!description: Fires event {@link #event:search search} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

attachSuggest.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:suggest suggest} event of this sap.ui.commons.SearchField. sap.ui.commons.RadioButtonGroup.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new RadioButtonGroup. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getColumns columns} : int (default: 1)
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getValueState valueState} : sap.ui.core.ValueState (default: None)
    • {@link #getSelectedIndex selectedIndex} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.core.Item[] (default)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

getSelectedItem.!description: When no item is selected, "null" is returned.

addAriaLabelledBy.!description: Adds some ariaLabelledBy into the association {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy}.

parameters.vAriaLabelledBy: type: sap.ui.core.ID|sap.ui.core.Control, description: The ariaLabelledBy to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

sap.ui.commons.RadioButtonGroup.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.RadioButtonGroup control.
The RadioButtonGroup is a basic control that is used to provide area for making interactive choice out of a set of options. It represents a list with items where exactly one item can be selected in a session. For the representation of the single group entries, the RadioButton items are created automatically. For the RadioButton choice, mouse and keyboard navigation usage is supported.

getItems.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getItems items}.

The RadioButtons of this RadioButtonGroup.

destroyItems.!description: Destroys all the items in the aggregation {@link #getItems items}.

removeAllItems.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getItems items}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

setSelectedIndex.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getSelectedIndex selectedIndex}. The index of the selected/checked RadioButton. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0.

parameters.iSelectedIndex: type: int, description: New value for property selectedIndex

removeAllAriaDescribedBy.!description: Removes all the controls in the association named {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy}.

getSelectedIndex.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSelectedIndex selectedIndex}. The index of the selected/checked RadioButton. Default value is 0.

insertItem.!description: Inserts a item into the aggregation {@link #getItems items}.

parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the item should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the item is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the item is inserted at the last position
parameters.oItem: type: sap.ui.core.Item, description: The item to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted

sap.ui.commons.Slider.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Slider. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getMin min} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getMax max} : float (default: 100)
    • {@link #getValue value} : float (default: 50)
    • {@link #getSmallStepWidth smallStepWidth} : float
    • {@link #getTotalUnits totalUnits} : int
    • {@link #getStepLabels stepLabels} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getLabels labels} : string[]
    • {@link #getVertical vertical} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:liveChange liveChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

parameters.vAriaLabelledBy: type: sap.ui.core.ID|sap.ui.core.Control, description: The ariaLabelledBy to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.RatingIndicator control.
RatingIndicator is used to let the user do some rating on a given topic. The amount of rating symbols can be specified, as well as the URIs to the image icons which shall be used as rating symbols. When the user performs a rating, an event is fired.

sap.ui.commons.Menu.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.21.0 replaced by {@link sap.ui.unified.Menu}
A menu is an interactive element which provides a choice of different actions to the user. These actions (items) can also be organized in submenus. Like other dialog-like controls, the menu is not rendered within the control hierarchy. Instead it can be opened at a specified position via a function call.

INFORMATION.!description: Shows the information icon in the message box.

SUCCESS.!description: Shows the success icon in the message box.

sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Icon.!description: Enumeration of the pre-defined icons that can be used in a MessageBox.

QUESTION.!description: Shows the question icon in the message box.

WARNING.!description: Shows the warning icon in the message box.

ERROR.!description: Shows the error icon in the message box.

CRITICAL.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.9.1 The error icon is used instead
Shows the critical error icon in the message box.

NONE.!description: Shows no icon in the message box.

End.!description: Top and bottom padding of 2px. Padding of 4px towards the end of a line, in the current locale's writing direction, but none towards its beginning.

Both.!description: Top and bottom padding of 2px. Padding of 4px towards both the beginning and end of a line.

sap.ui.commons.layout.Padding.!description: Padding, e.g. of a layout cell's content within the cell's borders. Note that all options except "None" include a padding of 2px at the top and bottom, and differ only in the presence of a 4px padding towards the beginning or end of a line, in the current locale's writing direction.

Begin.!description: Top and bottom padding of 2px. Padding of 4px towards the beginning of a line, in the current locale's writing direction, but none towards its end.

Neither.!description: Top and bottom padding of 2px. No padding towards neither the beginning nor end of a line.
