visible.!description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). See {@link sap.ui.core.RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData} for details.

minWidth.!description: Defines the minimal size in px of a ResponsiveFlowLayout element. The element will be shrunk down to this value.

vAlign.!description: Determines the vertical alignment of the matrix layout cell's content with the cell's borders.

columns.!description: Number of columns. If not specified, the number of columns will be determined from the given cells.

busy.!description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

padding.!description: Determines the padding of the matrix layout cell's content within the cell's borders. The default value is appropriate for all cells in a form-like layout. Consider to remove the padding on the outer layout in case of nesting.

colSpan.!description: Determines how many columns of the underlying grid structure are occupied by this matrix layout cell.

layoutFixed.!description: Sets the table layout. If fixed the width parameter of a column has priority, if not the width of the content of the colums has priority. The default is "fixed". If the fixed layout is used an adequate width of the MatrixLayout should be provided. Otherwise the column width displayed could be different than the given ones because of browser dependend optimazations.

overflowX.!description: The overflow mode of the area in horizontal direction as CSS value

overflowY.!description: The overflow mode of the area in vertical direction as CSS value

margin.!description: Prevents any margin of the element if set to false.

busyIndicatorDelay.!description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

right.!description: Defines the distance to the right of the layout (as specified in HTML)

centerVertically.!description: Indicates whether this container should be centered vertically within the AbsoluteLayout area. The values of the attributes top and bottom are ignored when this feature is activated.

enabled.!description: If not enabled, all controls inside are not enabled automatically.

backgroundDesign.!description: Determines the matrix layout cell's background design.

rtl.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.5.2 replaced by the global configuration for the page
The RTL setting swaps the areas Begin and End.

contentAlign.!description: The content alignment as CSS value

width.!description: Width of the VerticalLayout. If no width is set, the width of the content is used. If the content of the layout has a larger width than the layout, it is cut off. There is no scrolling inside the layout.

busyIndicatorSize.!description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

size.!description: Defines the height or the width. Is not used when the area element is in Center.

bottom.!description: Defines the distance to the bottom of the layout (as specified in HTML)

weight.!description: Defines the weight of the element, that influences the resulting width. If there are several elements within a row of the ResponsiveFlowLayout, each element could have another weight. The bigger the weight of a single element, the wider it will be stretched, i.e. a bigger weight results in a larger width.

linebreak.!description: If this property is set, the control in which the LayoutData is added, will always cause a line break within the ResponsiveFlowLayout.

hAlign.!description: Determines the horizontal alignment of the matrix layout cell's content with the cell's borders.

widths.!description: Widths of the columns. Use an array to define the widths of the columns. If a column shall have an automatical sizing enter "auto" for this column width.

centerHorizontally.!description: Indicates whether this container shall be centered horizontally within the AbsoluteLayout area. The values of the attributes left and right are ignored when this feature is activated.

areaId.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.3.3 Redundant to the aggregation by the parent border layout.
Defines which area the element represents: top, begin, center, end, bottom

horizontalScrolling.!description: 'Auto', 'Scroll', 'Hidden', and 'None' are the available values for setting the vertical scrolling mode.

rowSpan.!description: Determines how many rows of the underlying grid structure are occupied by this matrix layout cell. In case a row-height is used, all rows affected by the RowSpan must have the same unit.

left.!description: Defines the distance to the left of the layout (as specified in HTML)

top.!description: Defines the distance to the top of the layout (as specified in HTML)

verticalScrolling.!description: 'Auto', 'Scroll', 'Hidden', and 'None' are the available values for setting the vertical scrolling mode.

separation.!description: Determines how a matrix layout cell is separated from its predecessor, via a vertical gutter of variable width, with or without a vertical line.

linebreakable.!description: Shows if an element can be wrapped into a new row. If this value is set to false, the min-width will be set to 0 and the wrapping is up to the previous element.

responsive.!description: If set to false, all added controls will keep their width, or otherwise, the controls will be stretched to the possible width of a row.

fieldGroupIds.!description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is raised. See {@link sap.ui.core.Control#attachValidateFieldGroup}.

allowWrapping.!description: Specifies whether the content inside the Layout shall be line-wrapped in the case that there is less horizontal space available than required.

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.commons.CheckBox with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.core.Control.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to sap.ui.core.ElementMetadata
parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

valueTextAlign.!description: Determines the text alignment in the primary ListBox column.

columns.!description: Determines the maximum number of RadioButtons displayed in one line.

maxListed.!description: Maximum number of messages being display in the List before a scrollbar appears. Value '0' means no limit.

useMap.!description: The name of the image map that defines the clickable areas

firstVisibleIndex.!description: The index of the element in the content aggreation which is displayed first on rendering

showExternalButton.!description: Defines whether an additional search button shall be displayed

totalUnits.!description: Number of units that are displayed by ticks. The PageUp and PageDown keys navigate according to these units.

maxVisibleItems.!description: The maximum number of items which are displayed before an overflow mechanism takes effect. A value smaller than 1 means an infinite number of visible items. The overall height of the menu is limited by the height of the screen. If the maximum possible height is reached, an overflow takes effect, even if the maximum number of visible items is not yet reached.

iconHoverURL.!description: URL of the icon for the value help when hovered. If no parameter is supplied the standard icon image will be shown. If an icon font icon is used, this property is ignored.

styled.!description: Indicates if the button is styled. If not it is rendered as native HTML-button. In this case a custom styling can be added usig addStyleClass.

href.!description: The link target URI. Supports standard hyperlink behavior. If an action should be triggered, this should not be set, but instead an event handler for the "press" event should be registered.

collision.!description: Optional. Collision - when the positioned element overflows the window in some direction, move it to an alternative position.

mimeType.!description: The chosen files will be checked against an array of mime types. If at least one file does not fit the mime type restriction the upload is prevented. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9. Example: mimeType ["image/png", "image/jpeg"].

iconDisabledURL.!description: URL of the icon for the value help when disabled. If no parameter is supplied the default icon image will be shown. If an icon font icon is used, this property is ignored.

enableTabReordering.!description: Specifies whether tab reordering is enabled.

pageSize.!description: The keyboard can be used to navigate through the items of a menu. Beside the arrow keys for single steps and the Home / End keys for jumping to the first / last item, the Page Up / Page Down keys can be used to jump an arbitrary number of items up or down. This number can be defined via the pageSize property. For values smaller than 1, paging behaves in a similar way to when using the Home / End keys. If the value equals 1, the paging behavior is similar to that of the arrow keys.

enableClear.!description: Defines whether the clear functionality shall be active

textDirection.!description: Direction of the text. Possible values: "rtl", "ltr".

minHeight.!description: Minimum outer height of the dialog window. When set, neither the user nor some layout settings can make the window smaller.

anchorSnapPoint.!description: Type: sap.ui.core.Popup.Dock SnapPoint of MessageBar over anchorId. Note: Use "begin" or "end" for RTL support. Note: "center" is not indicated, as positioning is only set once, either via the css "left" or the "right" attribute. Therefore a MessageBar will only be extended in one direction, as Messages come in.

yyyymmdd.!description: Defines the date as a "yyyymmdd" string, independent from the format used. The inherited textField "value" attribute uses the date format as configured via the locale. The date is interpreted as gregorian date

numberOfPages.!description: Represents the overall number of pages that are embedded into the parent control

buttonOnly.!description: If set to "true", the FileUploader will be rendered as Button only, without showing the InputField.

groupName.!description: Defines the name of the RadioButtonGroup, in which the current RadioButton belongs to. You can define a new name for the group. If no new name is specified, the default is sapUiRbDefaultGroup. By default, when one of the RadioButtons in a group is selected, all others are unselected.

applyContentPadding.!description: Determines whether the Panel will have padding. Padding is theme-dependent.

searchHelpAdditionalText.!description: (optional) The additional Text to use for the search help entry.

minSizeSecondPane.!description: The minimum size (width for vertical splitter or height for horizontal splitter) of the second Pane

showValue.!description: Determines whether the percent value shall be rendered inside the bar.

maxLength.!description: Maximum number of characters. Value '0' means the feature is switched off.

visibleItems.!description: The ListBox height in number of items that are initially displayed without scrolling. This setting overwrites height settings in terms of CSS size that have been made. When the items have different heights, the height of the first item is used for all other item height calculations. Note that if there are one or more separators between the visible ListBox items, the displayed items might not relate 1:1 to the initially specified number of items. When the value is retrieved, it equals the previously set value if it was set; otherwise, it will be the number of items completely fitting into the ListBox without scrolling in the case the control was already rendered. Note that if the control was not rendered, the behavior will be undefined, it may return -1 or any other number.

TitleLevel.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.16.0 Moved to sap.ui.core library. Please use this one.
Level of a title.

maxValue.!description: Determines the number of displayed rating symbols

displaySecondaryValues.!description: Determines whether the text values from the additionalText property (see sap.ui.core.ListItems) shall be displayed.

max.!description: Maximal value of the slider Note: If min is larger than max both values will be switched

displayWelcome.!description: Determines if the welcome text is displayed

startsSection.!description: Defines whether a visual separator should be rendered before the item. Note: If an item is invisible also the separator of this item is not shown.

enableListSuggest.!description: Defines whether a pop up list shall be provided for suggestions

sap.ui.commons.Title: sap.ui.commons.Title_obj

selectionState.!description: Defines the states of the checkbox

displayLogoff.!description: Determines if the logoff area will be displayed at the right hand side of the application header.

sap.ui.commons.!description: Common basic controls, mainly intended for desktop scenarios

animationDuration.!description: Duration for animation when navigating through the contents of the Carousel

scrollLeft.!description: Determines the scroll position from left to right. Value "0" means leftmost position.

minSizeFirstPane.!description: The minimum size (width for vertical splitter or height for horizontal splitter) of the first Pane

sap.ui.commons.Label: sap.ui.commons.Label_obj

fieldGroupIds.!description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is raised. See {@link sap.ui.core.Control#attachValidateFieldGroup}.

checked.!description: Contains the state of the control whether it is flagged with a check mark, or not

suggestType.!description: The type of data which is provided by the given suggestUrl: either 'json' or 'xml'.

wrapping.!description: Disabled automatic wrapping of the text.

undoEnabled.!description: If undo is enabled after changing the text an undo button appears.

visible.!description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). See {@link sap.ui.core.RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData} for details.

busy.!description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

smallStepWidth.!description: The grip can only be moved in steps of this width.

uploadOnChange.!description: If set to "true", the upload immediately starts after file selection. With the default setting, the upload needs to be explicitly triggered.

maxWidth.!description: Determines the maximum width of the ListBox. If not set, there is no maximum width.

userName.!description: User name that will be displayed beside the welcome text

searchHelpIcon.!description: (optional) The URI of the icon to use for the search help entry.

key.!description: A key which can be used to identify the range (optional).

enabled.!description: Switches enabled state of the control. Disabled fields have different colors, and can not be focused.

text.!description: Defines the text displayed next to the check box

openedSectionsId.!description: Section IDs that are opened by default at application start

ariaDescription.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.27.0 replaced by ariaLabelledBy association
Accessible label / description of the menu for assistive technologies like screenreaders.

explanation.!description: text which appears, in case quick-help is switched on

labels.!description: Labels to be displayed instead of numbers. Attribute totalUnits and label count should be the same Note: To show the labels stepLabels must be activated.

width.!description: Width of text field. When it is set (CSS-size such as % or px), this is the exact size. When left blank, the text field length defines the width.

showCloseButton.!description: Displays a close button in the title bar.

visibleItemCount.!description: Defines the number of items in the suggestion list that shall be displayed at once. If the overall number of list items is higher than the setting, a scroll bar is provided.

logoText.!description: The text that will be displayed beside the logo in the application header. This property is optional.

editable.!description: Switches edit state of the control. Read-only fields have different colors, depending on theme setting.

secondaryValueTextAlign.!description: Determines the text alignment in the secondary ListBox text column (if available).

borderDesign.!description: Determines if the Panel can have a box as border. Note that displaying borders is theme-dependent.

handleSize.!description: Determines the size of the handle in pixels. (Height for vertical carousel, width for horizontal carousel)

dockMenu.!description: The position / edge (see sap.ui.core.Popup.Dock) of the menu which is docked to the button. Default is 'begin top'.

splitterPosition.!description: Position of splitter bar in percentage. The default value means that the splitter is positioned in the middle of the area that is available for the splitter.

searchHelpEnabled.!description: Whether the DropdownBox's search help should be enabled.

visualMode.!description: Defines how float values are visualized: Full, Half, Continuous (see enumeration RatingIndicatorVisualMode)

allowMultiSelect.!description: Determines whether multiple selection is allowed.

buttonText.!description: The Button text can be overwritten using this property.

areaDesign.!description: Determines the background color. Note that color settings are theme-dependent.

maxSuggestionItems.!description: Maximum number of suggestion items in the suggestion list.

atPosition.!description: Optional. At position defines which position on the target control to align the positioned tooltip.

logoSrc.!description: Path (src) to the logo icon to be displayed in the application header.

alt.!description: The alternative text that is displayed in case the Image is not available, or cannot be displayed. If the image is set to decorative this property is ignored.

name.!description: The name property to be used in the HTML code (e.g. for HTML forms that send data to the server via 'submit').

textAlign.!description: Sets the horizontal alignment of the text.

offset.!description: Optional. Offset adds these left-top values to the calculated position. Example: "10 3".

startSuggestion.!description: Minimum length of the entered string triggering the suggestion list.

multiple.!description: Allows multiple files to be chosen and uploaded from the same folder. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

uploadUrl.!description: Used when URL address is on a remote server.

enableFilterMode.!description: Defines whether the search event should also be fired when the SearchField is empty (like a Filter field) and when the clear button (if activated) is pressed.

icon.!description: Icon to display in front of the node

selectedIndex.!description: Specifies the index of the currently selected tab.

imageSrc.!description: If RichTooltip contains an image, this property is used to define the source path.

threshold.!description: Threshold to fetch the next chunk of data. The minimal threshold can be the numberOfRows of the RR.

defaultItemHeight.!description: Default height of the item in a carousel if no height can be determined

showHeader.!description: Tree Header is display. If false, the tree will be in a transparent mode

selectedItemId.!description: Id of the selected item. If the value has no corresponding item, the selectedItemId is empty. If the selectedItemId is set to a not existing item, it will not be changed.

iconURL.!description: URL of the standard icon for the value help. If no parameter is supplied the default icon image will be shown. This can be a URI to an image or an icon font URI.

stepLabels.!description: Display step numbers for the ticks on the slider.

showMoreSteps.!description: Step size used to increase the numberOfRows value. This feature is only active if value is greater than 0. This will deactivate the paging feature.

showScrollBars.!description: Specifies if the browser should display scroll bars or simply cut the content of a splitter pane when the content does not fit into its pane.

autoClose.!description: If this property is set to true the Dialog will close if the Dialog loses its focus

accessibleRole.!description: Accessibility role for the text field.

keepInWindow.!description: Specifies whether Dialog movement should be restricted to the visible area of the window. This only affects drag&drop movements by the user. This doesn't affect modal dialogs -> modal dialogs always stay in the window.

showCollapseIcon.!description: Determines whether the Panel will have an icon for collapsing/expanding, or not.

resizable.!description: Specifies whether the dialog window can be resized by the user. The dialog frame contains the visual symbol.

labeledBy.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.5.2 Please use association AriaLabelledBy instead.
ID of label control

showHorizontalScrollbar.!description: Display horizontal scrollbar. If false, the overflow content will be hidden

orientation.!description: Determines the orientation of the Carousel. Can be either "horizontal" or "vertical"

busyIndicatorSize.!description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

contentBorderDesign.!description: Specifies the border design. Border design is theme dependent.

imeMode.!description: State of the Input Method Editor (IME).

iconUnselected.!description: The URI to the image which shall be displayed for all unselected rating symbols. If this attribute is used, a requirement is that all custom icons need to have the same size. Note that when this attribute is used also the other icon attributes need to be set.

maxPopupItems.!description: Defines the number of items that shall be displayed at once. If the overall number of items is higher than this setting, a scrollbar is provided.

dockButton.!description: The position / edge (see sap.ui.core.Popup.Dock) of the button where the menu is docked. Default is 'begin bottom'.

iconSelected.!description: Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is selected (only if also a base icon was specified). If not specified the base or hovered icon is used. If an icon font icon is used, this property is ignored.

closeDelay.!description: Closing delay of the tooltip in milliseconds

sap.ui.commons.!helpDescription: Common basic controls, mainly intended for desktop scenarios

valueState.!description: Visualizes warnings or errors related to the text field. Possible values: Warning, Error, Success.

sameFilenameAllowed.!description: If the FileUploader is configured to upload the file directly after the file is selected it is not allowed to upload a file with the same name again. If a user should be allowed to upload a file with the same name again this parameter has to be "true". A typical use case would be if the files have different paths.

enableScrolling.!description: Determines whether scrolling should be enabled when the number of items is higher than maxPopupItems. If set to false only the first n items (n=maxPopupItems) are shown.

myPosition.!description: Optional. My position defines which position on the extended tooltip being positioned to align with the target control.

pressed.!description: The property is “true” when the control is toggled. The default state of this property is "false".

averageValue.!description: Determines the average value. This value is shown if no value is set. This can be used to display an average Value before the user votes.

helpId.!description: Unique identifier used for help service.

defaultItemWidth.!description: Default width of the item in a carousel if no height can be determined

value2.!description: Current second value of the slider. (Position of the second grip.) Note: If the value is not in the valid range (between min and max) it will be changed to be in the valid range. If it is smaller than value it will be set to the same value.

associatedElementId.!description: Associated UI element ID. (Optional) For navigation to error field.

src.!description: Relative or absolute path to URL where the image file is stored.

modal.!description: Specifies whether the dialog should be modal, or not. In case of true the focus is kept inside the dialog.

iconFirst.!description: If set to true (default), the display sequence is 1. icon 2. control text .

min.!description: Minimal value of the slider. Note: If min is larger than max both values will be switched

fileType.!description: The chosen files will be checked against an array of file types. If at least one file does not fit the file type restriction the upload is prevented. Example: ["jpg", "png", "bmp"].

imageAltText.!description: This is the alt text for the image

requiredAtBegin.!description: Determines whether the required indicator is at the beginning of the label (if set) or at the end (if not set).

emphasized.!description: If set the title is displayed emphasized. This feature is nor supported by all controls using the Title.control.

selectedStep.!description: ID of the step which is currently selected

displayIcons.!description: Determines whether the icons of the list items shall also be displayed. Enabling icons requires some space to be reserved for them. Displaying icons can also influence the width and height of a single item, which affects the overall height of the ListBox when defined in number of items. Note that the number of icons that can be displayed in the ListBox depends on the size of the icons themselves and of the total ListBox height.

valueStateText.!description: This property is an individual text that will be used instead of the default ValueState text

fixedRowHeight.!description: Row height adapts to rendered content. If a fixed height is specified the cells have a maximum height and the overflow will be hidden.

design.!description: Font type. valid values are Standard and Monospace.

maximumFileSize.!description: A file size limit in megabytes which prevents the upload if at least one file exceeds it. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

cols.!description: Number of Columns. Cols means number of characters per row. This proprty is only used if Width is not used.

minWidth.!description: Minimal width for the Tree. Can be useful when, for example, the width is specified in percentage, to avoid the tree to become too narrow when container is resize

maxHistoryItems.!description: Maximum number of history items in the suggestion list. 0 displays and stores no history. The history is locally stored on the client. Therefore do not activate this feature when this control handles confidential data.

level.!description:
Defines the level of the title. If set to auto the level of the title is chosen by the control rendering the title.

Currently not all controls using the Title.control supporting this property.

selectedKey.!description:
Key of the selected item.

If the value has no corresponding item the key is empty.

If duplicate keys exists the first item matching the key is used.

If the key is set to a not existing value it will not be changed.

busyIndicatorDelay.!description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

required.!description: Depending on theme the TextField is shown as required. If a Label is assigned to the TextField it will visualize the requires state too.

iconHovered.!description: Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is hovered (only if also a base icon was specified). If not specified the base icon is used. If an icon font icon is used, this property is ignored.

showListExpander.!description: Defines whether the list expander shall be displayed in the case of an enabled list for suggestions. This feature is deactivated on mobile devices.

shape.!description: The value is a string and can be 'rect' for rectangle, 'poly' for poligon, 'circle', or default.

displayValue.!description: Determines the text value that will be displayed in the bar.

semanticColor.!description: Semantic color of the text View

rows.!description: Number of Rows. This proprty is only used if Height is not used.

collapsed.!description: Determines whether the Panel will be initially collapsed. When it is initially collapsed, the contents are not rendered. A collapsed Panel consumes less space than an expanded one.

sendXHR.!description: If set to "true", the request will be sent as XHR request instead of a form submit. This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

maximumFilenameLength.!description: The maximum length of a filename which the FileUploader will accept. If the maximum filename length is exceeded, the corresponding Event 'filenameLengthExceed' is fired.

barColor.!description: Determines the color of the bar which visualizes the progress. Possible values defined in the sap.ui.core.BarColor enumeration are the following: CRITICAL (yellow), NEGATIVE (red), POSITIVE (green), NEUTRAL (blue) (default value).

maxHeight.!description: Maximum outer height of the dialog window. If set, neither the user nor some layout settings can make the window larger.

hasExpander.!description: Should the node has an expander.

maxToasted.!description: Maximum number of simultaneous messages being toasted in a row. Value '0' means this dynamic part is switched off.

iconOnly.!description: If set to true, the button is displayed without any text.

suggestUrl.!description: The URL for suggestions of the search provider. As placeholder for the concrete search queries '{searchTerms}' must be used. For cross domain requests maybe a proxy must be used.

numberOfVisibleSteps.!description: Total number of steps to be displayed at once

decorative.!description: A decorative image is included for design reasons. Accessibility tools will ignore decorative images. Note: If the Image has an image map (useMap is set), this property will be overridden (the image will not be rendered as decorative). A decorative image has no ALT attribute, so the Alt property is ignored if the image is decorative.

percentValue.!description: Determines the numerical value for the displayed length of the progress bar.

searchHelpText.!description: (optional) The text to use for the search help entry.

locale.!description: Defines the locale (language and country), e.g. "en-US", whose translations and Date formatters should be used to render the DatePicker.If the value property is bound to a model using a Date type the locale will be ignored, because the locale information of the model are used.

enableCache.!description: When list suggestion is enabled all suggestions are cached and no suggest event is fired.

openDelay.!description: Opening delay of the tooltip in milliseconds

showHeaderIcons.!description: Show Header icons (e.g. Expand/Collapse all). Only consider if showHeader is true

standalone.!description: Per default, tool bars have the stand alone status. Alternatively, they can be nested in other controls and then inherit the design from their parent control.

anchorId.!description: ID of the anchor on top of which the MessageToast is to render.

selected.!description:
Deprecated! Since 0.17.0 This property is not used. To identify the selected tab in a TabStrip selectedIndex is used.
Defines whether the tab is the active one.

closable.!description: Specifies whether the tab contains a close button.

scrollTop.!description: Determines the scroll position from top to bottom. Value "0" means topmost position.

lite.!description: The button is rendered as lite button.

splitterBarVisible.!description: set the splitter bar to be visible or not.

displayVisualSeparator.!description: When set to false, there is no visual indication of separation by a vertical line but by a wider space.

cursorPos.!description: Position of cursor, e.g., to let the user re-start typing at the same position as before the server roundtrip

firstVisibleStep.!description: ID of the first step to be displayed

useMultipart.!description: If set to "false", the request will be sent as file only request instead of a multipart/form-data request. Only one file could be uploaded using this type of request. Required for sending such a request is to set the property "sendXHR" to "true". This property is not supported by Internet Explorer 9.

additionalData.!description: Additional data that is sent to the back end service. Data will be transmitted as value of a hidden input where the name is derived from the name property with suffix -data.

anchorID.!description: Element ID upon which the MessageBar will be initially positioned.

selectable.!description: The node is selectable. If true, clicking on the node text triggers "selected" event

target.!description: Options are _self, _top, _blank, _parent, _search. Alternatively, a frame name can be entered.

splitterOrientation.!description: The splitter can have horizontal or vertical orientation.

currentPage.!description: The index of the page currently displayed. The index starts at 1.

getIconSelected.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getIconSelected iconSelected}. Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the button when it is selected (only if also a base icon was specified). If not specified the base or hovered icon is used. If an icon font icon is used, this property is ignored. Default value is empty string.

removeAriaLabelledBy.!description: Removes an ariaLabelledBy from the association named {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy}.

parameters.vAriaLabelledBy: type: int|sap.ui.core.ID|sap.ui.core.Control, description: The ariaLabelledBy to be removed or its index or ID

sap.ui.commons.Button.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Button. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getText text} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHelpId helpId} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI (default: )
    • {@link #getIconHovered iconHovered} : sap.ui.core.URI (default: )
    • {@link #getIconSelected iconSelected} : sap.ui.core.URI (default: )
    • {@link #getIconFirst iconFirst} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getStyled styled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getLite lite} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getStyle style} : sap.ui.commons.ButtonStyle (default: Default)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

setStyled.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getStyled styled}. Indicates if the button is styled. If not it is rendered as native HTML-button. In this case a custom styling can be added usig addStyleClass. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bStyled: type: boolean, description: New value for property styled

attachPress.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:press press} event of this sap.ui.commons.Button. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.commons.Button itself. Event is fired when the user presses the control.
attachPress.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.commons.Button

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.commons.Button itself

setHelpId.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getHelpId helpId}. Unique identifier used for help service When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is empty string.

parameters.sHelpId: type: string, description: New value for property helpId

parameters.vAriaLabelledBy: type: sap.ui.core.ID|sap.ui.core.Control, description: The ariaLabelledBy to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

sap.ui.commons.CalloutBase.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new CalloutBase. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Events
    • {@link #event:open open} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:close close} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:beforeOpen beforeOpen} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:opened opened} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.TooltipBase#constructor sap.ui.core.TooltipBase} can be used as well.

attachClose.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:close close} event of this sap.ui.commons.CalloutBase. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.commons.CalloutBase itself. Event is fired when the Callout window is closed.
attachClose.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.commons.CalloutBase

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.commons.CalloutBase itself

attachOpen.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:open open} event of this sap.ui.commons.CalloutBase. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.commons.CalloutBase itself. The event is fired when the popup is opened.
attachOpen.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.commons.CalloutBase

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs

sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.MessageBox control.
Provides methods to create standard alerts, confirmation dialogs, or arbitrary message boxes. As MessageBox is a static class, a jQuery.sap.require("sap.ui.commons.MessageBox"); statement must be explicitly executed before the class can be used. Example: 
  jQuery.sap.require("sap.ui.commons.MessageBox");
  sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.show(
      "This message should appear in the message box.",
      sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Icon.INFORMATION,
      "My message box title",
      [sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Action.YES, sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Action.NO],
      function() { / * do something * / }
  );

alert.!description:
Displays an alert box with the given message and an OK button (no icons). If a callback is given, it is called after the alert box has been closed by the user via the OK button or via the Close icon. The callback is called with the following signature: 
  function ()
The alert box opened by this method is modal and it is processed asynchronously. Applications have to use the fnCallback to continue work after the user closed the alert box.
alert.!type: fn(vMessage: String | sap.ui.core.Control, fnCallback?: fn(), sTitle?: String, sDialogId?: String)

show.!description: Creates and displays a simple message box with the given text and buttons, and optionally other parts. After the user has selected a button or closed the message box using the close icon, the callback function is invoked when given. The only mandatory parameter is vMessage. Either a string with the corresponding text or even a layout control could be provided. The created dialog box is executed asynchronously. When it has been created and registered for rendering, this function returns without waiting for a user reaction. When applications have to react on the users choice, they have to provide a callback function and postpone any reaction on the user choice until that callback is triggered. The signature of the callback is function (oAction); where oAction is the button that the user has pressed. When the user has pressed the close button, a MessageBox.Action.Close is returned.
show.!type: fn(vMessage: String | sap.ui.core.Control, oIcon?: sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Icon, sTitle?: String, vActions?: [sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Action | [object Object]], fnCallback?: fn(), oDefaultAction?: sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Action, sDialogId?: String)

confirm.!description:
Displays a confirmation dialog box with the given message, a question icon, an OK button, and a Cancel button. If a callback is given, it is called after the alert box has been closed by the user via one of the buttons or via the close icon. The callback is called with the following signature 
  function(bConfirmed)
where bConfirmed is set to true when the user has activated the OK button. The confirmation dialog box opened by this method is modal and it is processed asynchronously. Applications have to use the fnCallback to continue work after the user closed the alert box.
confirm.!type: fn(vMessage: String | sap.ui.core.Control, fnCallback?: fn(), sTitle?: String, sDialogId?: String)

sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.MessageBox control.
Provides methods to create standard alerts, confirmation dialogs, or arbitrary message boxes. As MessageBox is a static class, a jQuery.sap.require("sap.ui.commons.MessageBox"); statement must be explicitly executed before the class can be used. Example: 
  jQuery.sap.require("sap.ui.commons.MessageBox");
  sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.show(
      "This message should appear in the message box.",
      sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Icon.INFORMATION,
      "My message box title",
      [sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Action.YES, sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Action.NO],
      function() { / * do something * / }
  );

setValue2.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getValue2 value2}. Current second value of the slider. (Position of the second grip.) Note: If the value is not in the valid range (between min and max) it will be changed to be in the valid range. If it is smaller than value it will be set to the same value. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 80.

Can be useful when, for example, the width is specified in percentage, to avoid the tree to become too narrow when container is resize When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

expandAll.!description: Expands all nodes in the tree.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.commons.Tree itself. Event is fired when a tree node is selected.

sap.ui.commons.Tree.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Tree. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: auto)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: auto)
    • {@link #getShowHeader showHeader} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowHeaderIcons showHeaderIcons} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowHorizontalScrollbar showHorizontalScrollbar} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getMinWidth minWidth} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getSelectionMode selectionMode} : sap.ui.commons.TreeSelectionMode (default: Legacy)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getNodes nodes} : sap.ui.commons.TreeNode[] (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:selectionChange selectionChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

unbindNodes.!description: Unbinds aggregation {@link #getNodes nodes} from model data.

getShowHeader.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowHeader showHeader}. Tree Header is display. If false, the tree will be in a transparent mode Default value is true.

bindNodes.!description: Binds aggregation {@link #getNodes nodes} to model data. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#bindAggregation ManagedObject.bindAggregation} for a detailed description of the possible properties of oBindingInfo.

parameters.oBindingInfo: type: object, description: The binding information

indexOfNode.!description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.commons.TreeNode in the aggregation {@link #getNodes nodes}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

parameters.oNode: type: sap.ui.commons.TreeNode, description: The node whose index is looked for

Simple tree to display item in a hierarchical way

getShowHorizontalScrollbar.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowHorizontalScrollbar showHorizontalScrollbar}. Display horizontal scrollbar. If false, the overflow content will be hidden Default value is false.

setTitle.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getTitle title}. Tree title When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sTitle: type: string, description: New value for property title

addNode.!description: Adds some node to the aggregation {@link #getNodes nodes}.

parameters.oNode: type: sap.ui.commons.TreeNode, description: The node to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

setHeight.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getHeight height}. Tree height When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is auto.

parameters.sHeight: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property height

attachSelectionChange.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:selectionChange selectionChange} event of this sap.ui.commons.Tree. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.commons.Tree itself. fired when the selection of the tree has been changed
attachSelectionChange.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.commons.Tree

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.commons.Tree itself

getLocale.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getLocale locale}.

Defines the locale (language and country), e.g. "en-US", whose translations and Date formatters should be used to render the DatePicker.If the value property is bound to a model using a Date type the locale will be ignored, because the locale information of the model are used.

sap.ui.commons.DatePicker.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 replaced by {@link sap.m.DatePicker}
Allows end users to interact with dates. Entries can directly be written in, or selected from a calendar pad. Note: Dates can always be manually entered in the fix YYYYMMDD format, on top of the flexible "locale" format. If the value is provided via data binding, using a Date.type the formatter of the Date.type is used. Since version 1.22 the unified.Calendar is used inside the datePicker. So applications using the DatePicker should load the unified library. Otherwise it will be loaded the first time a DatePicker is opened.

fireChange.!description:
Fire event change to attached listeners. Provides the following event parameters:
  • 'newValue' of type string The new / changed value of the DatePicker.
  • 'newYyyymmdd' of type string The new / changed Yyyymmdd of the DatePicker.
  • 'invalidValue' of type boolean The new / changed value of the DatePicker is not a valid date.

parameters.bInvalidValue: type: boolean, description: true is value is invalid

getYyyymmdd.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getYyyymmdd yyyymmdd}.

Defines the date as a "yyyymmdd" string, independent from the format used. The inherited textField "value" attribute uses the date format as configured via the locale. The date is interpreted as gregorian date

setYyyymmdd.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getYyyymmdd yyyymmdd}. Defines the date as a "yyyymmdd" string, independent from the format used. The inherited textField "value" attribute uses the date format as configured via the locale. The date is interpreted as gregorian date When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sYyyymmdd: type: string, description: New value for property yyyymmdd

sap.ui.commons.DatePicker.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 replaced by {@link sap.m.DatePicker}
Allows end users to interact with dates. Entries can directly be written in, or selected from a calendar pad. Note: Dates can always be manually entered in the fix YYYYMMDD format, on top of the flexible "locale" format. If the value is provided via data binding, using a Date.type the formatter of the Date.type is used. Since version 1.22 the unified.Calendar is used inside the datePicker. So applications using the DatePicker should load the unified library. Otherwise it will be loaded the first time a DatePicker is opened.

sap.ui.commons.TriStateCheckBox.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new TriStateCheckBox. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSelectionState selectionState} : sap.ui.commons.TriStateCheckBoxState (default: Unchecked)
    • {@link #getText text} : string
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getValueState valueState} : sap.ui.core.ValueState (default: None)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getTextDirection textDirection} : sap.ui.core.TextDirection (default: Inherit)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

detachChange.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:change change} event of this sap.ui.commons.TriStateCheckBox. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

sap.ui.commons.TriStateCheckBox.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 undefined
TriStateCheckBox to reflect mixed state for checkboxes. The control can display three states, namely checked, unchecked and mixed. However, mixed state cannot be directly reached by user interaction on the particular control. It can be only set by the control's public toggle function, to make a behaviour possible which is e.g. required in checkbox trees.

fireChange.!description: Fires event {@link #event:change change} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

attachChange.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:change change} event of this sap.ui.commons.TriStateCheckBox. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.commons.TriStateCheckBox itself. Event is triggered when the control status is changed by the user by flagging or unflagging the checkbox.
attachChange.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.commons.TriStateCheckBox

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.commons.TriStateCheckBox itself

getSelectionState.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSelectionState selectionState}. Defines the states of the checkbox Default value is Unchecked.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.commons.TriStateCheckBox.

It can be only set by the control's public toggle function, to make a behaviour possible which is e.g. required in checkbox trees.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSplitterOrientation splitterOrientation} : sap.ui.core.Orientation (default: Vertical)
    • {@link #getSplitterPosition splitterPosition} : sap.ui.core.Percentage (default: 50%)
    • {@link #getMinSizeFirstPane minSizeFirstPane} : sap.ui.core.Percentage (default: 0%)
    • {@link #getMinSizeSecondPane minSizeSecondPane} : sap.ui.core.Percentage (default: 0%)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.commons.SplitterSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.commons.SplitterSize (default: 100%)
    • {@link #getShowScrollBars showScrollBars} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getSplitterBarVisible splitterBarVisible} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getFirstPaneContent firstPaneContent} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getSecondPaneContent secondPaneContent} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

getSplitterPosition.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSplitterPosition splitterPosition}. Position of splitter bar in percentage. The default value means that the splitter is positioned in the middle of the area that is available for the splitter. Default value is 50%.

destroySecondPaneContent.!description: Destroys all the secondPaneContent in the aggregation {@link #getSecondPaneContent secondPaneContent}.

setMinSizeFirstPane.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getMinSizeFirstPane minSizeFirstPane}. The minimum size (width for vertical splitter or height for horizontal splitter) of the first Pane When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0%.

parameters.sMinSizeFirstPane: type: sap.ui.core.Percentage, description: New value for property minSizeFirstPane

sap.ui.commons.Splitter.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.ui.layout.Splitter control.
Allows to split the screen into two areas. Make sure that the container for the splitter has an absolute height or set an absolute height for the splitter using the height property. Otherwise the height of the splitter is calculated by the height of its contents.

removeAllSecondPaneContent.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getSecondPaneContent secondPaneContent}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

removeAllFirstPaneContent.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getFirstPaneContent firstPaneContent}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

indexOfFirstPaneContent.!description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.core.Control in the aggregation {@link #getFirstPaneContent firstPaneContent}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

parameters.oFirstPaneContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The firstPaneContent whose index is looked for

setHeight.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getHeight height}. The height of the split area in px or in % When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 100%.

parameters.sHeight: type: sap.ui.commons.SplitterSize, description: New value for property height

getSecondPaneContent.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getSecondPaneContent secondPaneContent}.

Controls inside the second pane. These are the right ones in case of defining a vertical splitter, and the bottom ones in case of using the horizontal splitter.

setSplitterPosition.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getSplitterPosition splitterPosition}. Position of splitter bar in percentage. The default value means that the splitter is positioned in the middle of the area that is available for the splitter. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 50%.

parameters.sSplitterPosition: type: sap.ui.core.Percentage, description: New value for property splitterPosition

indexOfSecondPaneContent.!description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.core.Control in the aggregation {@link #getSecondPaneContent secondPaneContent}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

parameters.oSecondPaneContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The secondPaneContent whose index is looked for

setShowScrollBars.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowScrollBars showScrollBars}. Specifies if the browser should display scroll bars or simply cut the content of a splitter pane when the content does not fit into its pane. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bShowScrollBars: type: boolean, description: New value for property showScrollBars

sap.ui.commons.Splitter.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.ui.layout.Splitter control.
Allows to split the screen into two areas. Make sure that the container for the splitter has an absolute height or set an absolute height for the splitter using the height property. Otherwise the height of the splitter is calculated by the height of its contents.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.commons.Splitter.

getSplitterOrientation.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSplitterOrientation splitterOrientation}. The splitter can have horizontal or vertical orientation. Default value is Vertical.

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.commons.ColorPicker with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.core.Control.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to sap.ui.core.ElementMetadata
parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

getAutoClose.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getAutoClose autoClose}. If this property is set to true the Dialog will close if the Dialog loses its focus Default value is false.

setMaxHeight.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getMaxHeight maxHeight}. Maximum outer height of the dialog window. If set, neither the user nor some layout settings can make the window larger. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sMaxHeight: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property maxHeight

setModal.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getModal modal}. Specifies whether the dialog should be modal, or not. In case of true the focus is kept inside the dialog. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bModal: type: boolean, description: New value for property modal

removeButton.!description: Removes a button from the aggregation {@link #getButtons buttons}.

parameters.vButton: type: int|string|sap.ui.core.Control, description: The button to remove or its index or id

getResizable.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getResizable resizable}. Specifies whether the dialog window can be resized by the user. The dialog frame contains the visual symbol. Default value is true.

getScrollLeft.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getScrollLeft scrollLeft}. Scroll position from left to right. "0" means leftmost position. Default value is 0.

setApplyContentPadding.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getApplyContentPadding applyContentPadding}. Padding is theme-dependent. When set to "false", the content extends to the dialog borders. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bApplyContentPadding: type: boolean, description: New value for property applyContentPadding

getTitle.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getTitle title}. Dialog title displayed in the header. Default value is empty string.

getWidth.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getWidth width}.

Outer width of dialog window. When not set and not constrained by one of the width parameters (minWidth/maxWidth), the window size is automatically adapted to the content.

getShowCloseButton.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowCloseButton showCloseButton}. Displays a close button in the title bar. Default value is true.

getApplyContentPadding.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getApplyContentPadding applyContentPadding}. Padding is theme-dependent. When set to "false", the content extends to the dialog borders. Default value is true.

addContent.!description: Adds some content to the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The content to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

getContent.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

Aggregation of the content of the dialog (one or more controls).

Warning: when content is added with width given as a percentage, the Dialog itself should have a width set.

removeAllContent.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

getMinWidth.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getMinWidth minWidth}.

Minimum outer width of the dialog window. When set, neither the user nor some layout settings can make the window smaller.

sap.ui.commons.Dialog.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Dialog. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getScrollLeft scrollLeft} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getScrollTop scrollTop} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string (default: )
    • {@link #getApplyContentPadding applyContentPadding} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowCloseButton showCloseButton} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getResizable resizable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getMinWidth minWidth} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getMinHeight minHeight} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getMaxWidth maxWidth} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getMaxHeight maxHeight} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getContentBorderDesign contentBorderDesign} : sap.ui.commons.enums.BorderDesign (default: None)
    • {@link #getModal modal} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAccessibleRole accessibleRole} : sap.ui.core.AccessibleRole (default: Dialog)
    • {@link #getKeepInWindow keepInWindow} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAutoClose autoClose} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getButtons buttons} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getDefaultButton defaultButton} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.commons.Button)
    • {@link #getInitialFocus initialFocus} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:closed closed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

getOpenState.!description: Indicates whether the Dialog is currently open, closed, or transitioning between these states.

fireClosed.!description: Fires event {@link #event:closed closed} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

setKeepInWindow.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getKeepInWindow keepInWindow}. Specifies whether Dialog movement should be restricted to the visible area of the window. This only affects drag&drop movements by the user. This doesn't affect modal dialogs -> modal dialogs always stay in the window. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bKeepInWindow: type: boolean, description: New value for property keepInWindow

getAccessibleRole.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getAccessibleRole accessibleRole}. The ARIA role for the control. E.g. for alert-style Dialogs this can be set to "AlertDialog". Default value is Dialog.

getMaxHeight.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getMaxHeight maxHeight}.

Maximum outer height of the dialog window. If set, neither the user nor some layout settings can make the window larger.

setTitle.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getTitle title}. Dialog title displayed in the header. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is empty string.

parameters.sTitle: type: string, description: New value for property title

setHeight.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getHeight height}. Outer height of dialog window. When not set and not constrained by one of the height parameters (minHeight/maxHeight), the window size is automatically adapted to the content. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sHeight: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property height

getKeepInWindow.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getKeepInWindow keepInWindow}. Specifies whether Dialog movement should be restricted to the visible area of the window. This only affects drag&drop movements by the user. This doesn't affect modal dialogs -> modal dialogs always stay in the window. Default value is false.

setAutoClose.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getAutoClose autoClose}. If this property is set to true the Dialog will close if the Dialog loses its focus When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bAutoClose: type: boolean, description: New value for property autoClose

detachClosed.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:closed closed} event of this sap.ui.commons.Dialog. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

sap.ui.commons.Dialog.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.Dialog control.
An interactive window appearing on request displaying information to the user. The API supports features such as popups with fixed sizes, popups with unlimited width, scrolling bars for large windows, and control nesting (for example, a drop-down list can be included in the window).

getSelectable.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSelectable selectable}. The node is selectable. If true, clicking on the node text triggers "selected" event Default value is true.

removeAllAriaLabelledBy.!description: Removes all the controls in the association named {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy}.

getHasExpander.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getHasExpander hasExpander}. Should the node has an expander. Default value is false.

sap.ui.commons.TreeNode.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new TreeNode. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getText text} : string
    • {@link #getExpanded expanded} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHasExpander hasExpander} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getIsSelected isSelected} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSelectable selectable} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getNodes nodes} : sap.ui.commons.TreeNode[] (default)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSelectedForNodes selectedForNodes} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.commons.TreeNode)[]
    • {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:toggleOpenState toggleOpenState} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:selected selected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

detachToggleOpenState.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:toggleOpenState toggleOpenState} event of this sap.ui.commons.TreeNode. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

indexOfNode.!description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.commons.TreeNode in the aggregation {@link #getNodes nodes}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

parameters.oNode: type: sap.ui.commons.TreeNode, description: The node whose index is looked for

addAriaLabelledBy.!description: Adds some ariaLabelledBy into the association {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy}.

parameters.vAriaLabelledBy: type: sap.ui.core.ID|sap.ui.core.Control, description: The ariaLabelledBy to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

sap.ui.commons.TreeNode.!description:

parameters.bExpanded: type: boolean, description: New value for property expanded

addNode.!description: Adds some node to the aggregation {@link #getNodes nodes}.

parameters.oNode: type: sap.ui.commons.TreeNode, description: The node to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

attachToggleOpenState.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:toggleOpenState toggleOpenState} event of this sap.ui.commons.TreeNode. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.commons.TreeNode itself. Node state has changed.
attachToggleOpenState.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.commons.TreeNode

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.commons.TreeNode itself

setIcon.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getIcon icon}. Icon to display in front of the node When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sIcon: type: sap.ui.core.URI, description: New value for property icon

removeAllAriaDescribedBy.!description: Removes all the controls in the association named {@link #getAriaDescribedBy ariaDescribedBy}.

sap.ui.commons.layout.ResponsiveFlowLayo.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.16.0 moved to sap.ui.layout library. Please use this one.
This is a layout where several controls can be added. These controls are blown up to fit a whole line. If the window resizes the controls are moved between the lines and resized again.
