sap.ui.commons.ComboBox.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ComboBox. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getMaxPopupItems maxPopupItems} : int (default: 10)
    • {@link #getDisplaySecondaryValues displaySecondaryValues} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSelectedKey selectedKey} : string
    • {@link #getSelectedItemId selectedItemId} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.core.ListItem[] (default)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getListBox listBox} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.commons.ListBox)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.commons.TextField#constructor sap.ui.commons.TextField} can be used as well.

onsapenter.!description: Handle sapenter pseudo events on the control

parameters.oEvent: type: jQuery.Event, description: The event object.

setDisplaySecondaryValues.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getDisplaySecondaryValues displaySecondaryValues}. Indicates whether the additionalText property that is available for sap.ui.core.ListItem shall be displayed in the list. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bDisplaySecondaryValues: type: boolean, description: New value for property displaySecondaryValues

getListBox.!description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association {@link #getListBox listBox}, or null.

getMaxPopupItems.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getMaxPopupItems maxPopupItems}. Defines the number of items that shall be displayed at once. If the overall number of items is higher than this setting, a scrollbar is provided. Default value is 10.

sap.ui.commons.ComboBox.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 replaced by {@link sap.m.ComboBox}
The control provides a field that allows end users to either enter some text, or to choose an entry out of a list of pre-defined items. The choosable items can be provided in the form of a complete ListBox, single ListItems.

getItems.!description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getItems items}. ListItems (see sap.ui.core.ListBox) that shall be displayed in the list.

fireChange.!description:
Fire event change to attached listeners. Expects following event parameters:
  • 'newValue' of type string The new / changed value of the textfield.
  • 'selectedItem' of type sap.ui.core.ListItem selected item

parameters.mArguments: type: Map, description: the arguments to pass along with the event.

destroyItems.!description: Destroys all the items in the aggregation {@link #getItems items}.

getSelectedItemId.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSelectedItemId selectedItemId}. Id of the selected item. If the value has no corresponding item, the selectedItemId is empty. If the selectedItemId is set to a not existing item, it will not be changed.

removeAllItems.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getItems items}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

onsapshow.!description: Handle sapshow pseudo events on the control

parameters.oEvent: type: jQuery.Event, description: The event object.

getSelectedKey.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getSelectedKey selectedKey}.

Key of the selected item.

If the value has no corresponding item the key is empty.

If duplicate keys exists the first item matching the key is used.

If the key is set to a not existing value it will not be changed.

setSelectedItemId.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getSelectedItemId selectedItemId}. Id of the selected item. If the value has no corresponding item, the selectedItemId is empty. If the selectedItemId is set to a not existing item, it will not be changed. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sSelectedItemId: type: string, description: New value for property selectedItemId

insertItem.!description: Inserts a item into the aggregation {@link #getItems items}.

parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the item should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the item is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the item is inserted at the last position
parameters.oItem: type: sap.ui.core.ListItem, description: The item to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted

sap.ui.commons.ComboBox.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 replaced by {@link sap.m.ComboBox}
The control provides a field that allows end users to either enter some text, or to choose an entry out of a list of pre-defined items. The choosable items can be provided in the form of a complete ListBox, single ListItems.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.commons.ComboBox.

getAlt.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getAlt alt}.

The alternative text that is displayed in case the Image is not available, or cannot be displayed. If the image is set to decorative this property is ignored.

getDecorative.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDecorative decorative}. A decorative image is included for design reasons. Accessibility tools will ignore decorative images. Note: If the Image has an image map (useMap is set), this property will be overridden (the image will not be rendered as decorative). A decorative image has no ALT attribute, so the Alt property is ignored if the image is decorative. Default value is true.

extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to sap.ui.core.ElementMetadata
parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

firePress.!description: Fires event {@link #event:press press} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

setUseMap.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getUseMap useMap}. The name of the image map that defines the clickable areas When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sUseMap: type: string, description: New value for property useMap

sap.ui.commons.Image.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Image. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSrc src} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getDecorative decorative} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getAlt alt} : string
    • {@link #getUseMap useMap} : string
  • Events
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

attachPress.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:press press} event of this sap.ui.commons.Image. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.commons.Image itself. Event is fired when the user clicks on the control.
attachPress.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.commons.Image

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.commons.Image itself

setDecorative.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getDecorative decorative}. A decorative image is included for design reasons. Accessibility tools will ignore decorative images. Note: If the Image has an image map (useMap is set), this property will be overridden (the image will not be rendered as decorative). A decorative image has no ALT attribute, so the Alt property is ignored if the image is decorative. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bDecorative: type: boolean, description: New value for property decorative

setAlt.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getAlt alt}. The alternative text that is displayed in case the Image is not available, or cannot be displayed. If the image is set to decorative this property is ignored. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sAlt: type: string, description: New value for property alt

getHeight.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getHeight height}.

When the empty value is kept, the original size is not changed. It is also possible to make settings for width or height only, the overall size is maintained then, considering the aspect ratio.

sap.ui.commons.Image.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 replaced by {@link sap.m.Image}
A wrapper around the IMG tag. The image can be loaded from a remote or local server. There are various size setting options available, and the images can be combined with actions.

setSrc.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getSrc src}. Relative or absolute path to URL where the image file is stored. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sSrc: type: sap.ui.core.URI, description: New value for property src

setHeight.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getHeight height}. When the empty value is kept, the original size is not changed. It is also possible to make settings for width or height only, the overall size is maintained then, considering the aspect ratio. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sHeight: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property height

getUseMap.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getUseMap useMap}.

The name of the image map that defines the clickable areas

getWidth.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getWidth width}.

When the empty value is kept, the original size is not changed. It is also possible to make settings for width or height only, the overall size is maintained then, considering the aspect ratio.

setWidth.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getWidth width}. When the empty value is kept, the original size is not changed. It is also possible to make settings for width or height only, the overall size is maintained then, considering the aspect ratio. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sWidth: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property width

detachPress.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:press press} event of this sap.ui.commons.Image. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

getSrc.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getSrc src}.

Relative or absolute path to URL where the image file is stored.

sap.ui.commons.RoadMapStep.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new RoadMapStep. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getLabel label} : string
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getExpanded expanded} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSubSteps subSteps} : sap.ui.commons.RoadMapStep[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

getLabel.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getLabel label}.

Label of the step

getVisible.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getVisible visible}. Step is visible Default value is true.

removeAllSubSteps.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.10.5 Sub steps will not be supported in future. This feature might be removed in one of the next releases.
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getSubSteps subSteps}. Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

setExpanded.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.10.5 Note that sub steps will not be supported in future. This feature might be removed in one of the next releases.
Sets a new value for property {@link #getExpanded expanded}. This property is only relevant when using sub steps. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bExpanded: type: boolean, description: New value for property expanded

getSubSteps.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.10.5 Sub steps will not be supported in future. This feature might be removed in one of the next releases.
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getSubSteps subSteps}. Sub steps for the current step. Will be displayed only in the case that the step is expanded. Otherwise, special arrows show the availability of sub steps. One level of sub steps supported.

setEnabled.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getEnabled enabled}. Specifies whether the user shall be allowed to click a step, or not When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bEnabled: type: boolean, description: New value for property enabled

addSubStep.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.10.5 Sub steps will not be supported in future. This feature might be removed in one of the next releases.
Adds some subStep to the aggregation {@link #getSubSteps subSteps}.

parameters.oSubStep: type: sap.ui.commons.RoadMapStep, description: The subStep to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

destroySubSteps.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.10.5 Sub steps will not be supported in future. This feature might be removed in one of the next releases.
Destroys all the subSteps in the aggregation {@link #getSubSteps subSteps}.

The history is locally stored on the client. Therefore do not activate this feature when this control handles confidential data. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0.

sap.ui.commons.DropdownBox.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new DropdownBox. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSearchHelpEnabled searchHelpEnabled} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSearchHelpText searchHelpText} : string
    • {@link #getSearchHelpAdditionalText searchHelpAdditionalText} : string
    • {@link #getSearchHelpIcon searchHelpIcon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getMaxHistoryItems maxHistoryItems} : int (default: 0)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:searchHelp searchHelp} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.commons.ComboBox#constructor sap.ui.commons.ComboBox} can be used as well.

getSearchHelpAdditionalText.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getSearchHelpAdditionalText searchHelpAdditionalText}.

(optional) The additional Text to use for the search help entry.

setSearchHelpText.!description: Overwrite of Setter for property searchHelpText. Default value is empty/undefined

parameters.sSearchHelpText: type: string, description: new value for property searchHelpText

getSearchHelpText.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getSearchHelpText searchHelpText}.

(optional) The text to use for the search help entry.

parameters.oEvent: type: jQuery.Event, description: the occuring event

getSearchHelpIcon.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getSearchHelpIcon searchHelpIcon}.

(optional) The URI of the icon to use for the search help entry.

The history is locally stored on the client. Therefore do not activate this feature when this control handles confidential data. Default value is 0.

getBarColor.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getBarColor barColor}. Determines the color of the bar which visualizes the progress. Possible values defined in the sap.ui.core.BarColor enumeration are the following: CRITICAL (yellow), NEGATIVE (red), POSITIVE (green), NEUTRAL (blue) (default value). Default value is NEUTRAL.

setBarColor.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getBarColor barColor}. Determines the color of the bar which visualizes the progress. Possible values defined in the sap.ui.core.BarColor enumeration are the following: CRITICAL (yellow), NEGATIVE (red), POSITIVE (green), NEUTRAL (blue) (default value). When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is NEUTRAL.

parameters.sBarColor: type: sap.ui.core.BarColor, description: New value for property barColor

setDisplayValue.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getDisplayValue displayValue}. Determines the text value that will be displayed in the bar. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0%.

parameters.sDisplayValue: type: string, description: New value for property displayValue

sap.ui.commons.ProgressIndicator.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ProgressIndicator. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getBarColor barColor} : sap.ui.core.BarColor (default: NEUTRAL)
    • {@link #getDisplayValue displayValue} : string (default: 0%)
    • {@link #getPercentValue percentValue} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getShowValue showValue} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 100%)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

setShowValue.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowValue showValue}. Determines whether the percent value shall be rendered inside the bar. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bShowValue: type: boolean, description: New value for property showValue

getShowValue.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowValue showValue}. Determines whether the percent value shall be rendered inside the bar. Default value is true.

sap.ui.commons.ProgressIndicator.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.ProgressIndicator control.
Shows the progress of a process in a graphical way. The indicator can be displayed with or without numerical values. The filling can be displayed in color only, or additionally with the percentage rate. The indicator status can be interactive.

setPercentValue.!description: Sets the new percent value which the ProgressIndicator should display. A new rendering is not necessary, only the bar has to be moved.

parameters.iPercentValue: type: int, description: The new percent value of the ProgressIndicator.

setEnabled.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getEnabled enabled}. Determines whether the control is enabled or not. Disabled controls have different colors, and can not be focused. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bEnabled: type: boolean, description: New value for property enabled

getWidth.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getWidth width}. Determines the width of the control. Default value is 100%.

getDisplayValue.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDisplayValue displayValue}. Determines the text value that will be displayed in the bar. Default value is 0%.

setWidth.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getWidth width}. Determines the width of the control. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 100%.

parameters.sWidth: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property width

sap.ui.commons.ProgressIndicator.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.ProgressIndicator control.
Shows the progress of a process in a graphical way. The indicator can be displayed with or without numerical values. The filling can be displayed in color only, or additionally with the percentage rate. The indicator status can be interactive.

YES.!description: Adds a "Yes" button to the message box.

OK.!description: Adds an "Ok" button to the message box.

sap.ui.commons.MessageBox.Action.!description:
Enumeration of supported actions in a MessageBox.

Each action is represented as a button in the message box. The values of this enumeration are used for both, specifying the set of allowed actions as well as reporting back the user choice.

IGNORE.!description: Adds an "Ignore" button to the message box.

CLOSE.!description: Adds a "Close" button to the message box.

ABORT.!description: Adds an "Abort" button to the message box.

RETRY.!description: Adds a "Retry" button to the message box.

NO.!description: Adds a "No" button to the message box.

CANCEL.!description: Adds a "Cancel" button to the message box.

sap.ui.commons.AccordionSection.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new AccordionSection. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getMaxHeight maxHeight} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getCollapsed collapsed} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:scroll scroll} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.AccordionSection.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 undefined
Represents a panel which is a container for other controls. The container does not have any layout function.

insertContent.!description: Inserts a content into the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The content to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the content should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the content is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the content is inserted at the last position

parameters.bCollapsed: type: boolean, description: Whether the AccordionSection is collapsed or not

getCollapsed.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.34 Use Accordion's "openedSectionsId" property
Gets current value of property {@link #getCollapsed collapsed}. It is recommended to adjust the settings for the width when the section is set to 'collapsed'. Default value is false.

getMaxHeight.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getMaxHeight maxHeight}.

When the section content exceeds maxHeight, a vertical scroll bar appears.

setTitle.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getTitle title}. Text for the section header When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sTitle: type: string, description: New value for property title

sap.ui.commons.AccordionSection.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 undefined
Represents a panel which is a container for other controls. The container does not have any layout function.

indexOfSection.!description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.commons.AccordionSection in the aggregation {@link #getSections sections}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

parameters.oSection: type: sap.ui.commons.AccordionSection, description: The section whose index is looked for

addSection.!description: Adds some section to the aggregation {@link #getSections sections}.

parameters.oSection: type: sap.ui.commons.AccordionSection, description: The section to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

getWidth.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getWidth width}. When the specified width is less than the width of a section content, a horizontal scroll bar is provided. Default value is 200px.

setWidth.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getWidth width}. When the specified width is less than the width of a section content, a horizontal scroll bar is provided. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 200px.

parameters.sWidth: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property width

closeSection.!description: Closes a section and opens the default one

parameters.sSectionId: type: string, description: Id of the section that is being closed

attachSectionClose.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:sectionClose sectionClose} event of this sap.ui.commons.Accordion. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.commons.Accordion itself. Event is triggered when the user closes a section.

sap.ui.commons.Accordion.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Accordion. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 200px)
    • {@link #getOpenedSectionsId openedSectionsId} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSections sections} : sap.ui.commons.AccordionSection[] (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:sectionOpen sectionOpen} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:sectionClose sectionClose} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:sectionsReorder sectionsReorder} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.commons.Accordion.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 undefined
Contains N sections, acting as containers for any library control

getSections.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getSections sections}.

Empty container used to display any library control

detachSectionClose.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:sectionClose sectionClose} event of this sap.ui.commons.Accordion. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

removeAllSections.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getSections sections}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

Contains N sections, acting as containers for any library control

Default is 'begin bottom'. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sDockButton: type: string, description: New value for property dockButton

sap.ui.commons.MenuButton.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new MenuButton. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getDockButton dockButton} : string
    • {@link #getDockMenu dockMenu} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getMenu menu} : sap.ui.unified.Menu (default)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:itemSelected itemSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.commons.Button#constructor sap.ui.commons.Button} can be used as well.

attachPress.!description:
Attach event-handler fnFunction to the 'press' event of this sap.ui.commons.MenuButton.
Event is fired when an item from the menu was selected.
attachPress.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.commons.MenuButton

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to call, when the event occurs. This function will be called on the oListener-instance (if present) or in a 'static way'.
parameters.oData: type: object, description: The object, that should be passed along with the event-object when firing the event.
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Object on which to call the given function. If empty, the global context (window) is used.

attachItemSelected.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:itemSelected itemSelected} event of this sap.ui.commons.MenuButton. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.commons.MenuButton itself. Event that is fired when a menu item is selected by the user
attachItemSelected.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: fn(), oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.commons.MenuButton

parameters.fnFunction: type: function, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event
parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.commons.MenuButton itself

getDockButton.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getDockButton dockButton}.

The position / edge (see sap.ui.core.Popup.Dock) of the button where the menu is docked. Default is 'begin bottom'.

sap.ui.commons.MenuButton.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.38 Instead, use the sap.m.MenuButton control.
Common button control that opens a menu when clicked by the user. The control provides an API for configuring the docking position of the menu.
